title: Delhi police supporting stone-pelters? Congress members share video from UP
author: www.altnews.in
vclaim:
A two-minute video in which a mob can be seen pelting stones in front of policemen has gone viral. Later in the video, we see the police and the mob attack together. According to social media claims, this video is from the recent Delhi riots.

On February 29, Nagma, Indian National Congress (INC) member and former actor tweeted (archive link) the viral video. Her tweet was retweeted over 6,700 times and the video was viewed over 1.5 lakh times.

Similarly, on March 1, Digvijaya Singh, INC member and the former chief minister of Madhya Pradesh, also shared (archive link) the viral video. In the video description, the text posted by Nagma on Twitter is also added. The post was shared over 1,300 times and the video has over 47,000 views.

Similarly, several users posted the viral video on Twitter and Facebook.

On January 1, Times of India (ToI) published a report along with the viral video. According to the report, the video shows anti-CAA protest in Firozabad on December 20, 2019. The report describes the video as follows, “a group of 15-20 civilians, along with cops, is seen barging inside a wooden shop (Raja ki Lakdi ki Taal) owned by one Raja Khan. The men throw stones, vandalise shop and later set ablaze woods kept inside the shop. It’s located on Shikohabad Adda Road at Vakeelpura Mandi, close to Nalband chouraha under Rasoolpur police jurisdiction.”

Interestingly, Singh had tweeted archive link ) this ToI report on January 1, 2020.

The video in ToI‘s report was uploaded by Online Express, a YouTube channel, on December 31, 2019.

Therefore, INC members Digvijaya Singh and Nagma along with several other social media users falsely claimed that the viral video is from Delhi riots.
